page.title: 06Anglican Church, Trimpley
page.content: The Church of the Holy Trinity was consecrated in 1844.It seats about 80 and has a choir and organ. Average attendance is 20, rising to 80 on special occasions. It is part of the Kidderminster Parish Church Team Ministry with 3 other churches, led by 4 paid and 4 non-stipendiary clergy. Each Sunday has a service at 9.30 am, Mattins alternating with Holy Communion. Once a month the 1662 service is used, often attracting visitors. There are special Christmas and Easter services. In January a plough is blessed in church. In May, Rogation Day is marked by a service blessing crops and animals, when the people sing and pray in field, garden, village hall and churchyard in turn. Harvest Thanksgiving follows in October.Fund-raising occasions include a yearly Bonfire and 2-yearly fete.
